subject: Business
title: Compound Interest: The Eighth Wonder
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Compound Interest: The Eighth Wonder.

hook.text: Invest $1,000 at 10% annually. In 30 years it becomes $17,449 â€” without adding a single dollar.

buildup.text: Compound interest means you earn interest on your interest. Each year, the base grows larger.

discovery.text: The Rule of 72: divide 72 by the interest rate to estimate how many years it takes to double your money.

twist.text: Compound interest works against you too. Credit card debt at 24% doubles in just three years.

climax.text: Warren Buffett made 99% of his wealth after age 50. Compounding rewards patience above all else.

punchline.text: Time is the ingredient. Compound interest is the recipe.

quiz.question: Using the Rule of 72, how long does it take money to double at 8% annual interest?
